@bradfitz I'm sorry. The "mydomain" is exactly "http://localhost". I've edited it. I was confused before. It's just because the broswer don't know whether it's a directory or file. Broswer distinguish them by the "/" at the end of the URL. So a directory ended without "/" will be treated as a file by broswer. Here an example: view-source:localhost:3000/.vim ```html 
.netrwhist
autoload/
bundle/
vimrc
``` There is nothing wrong in href. But since "localhost:3000/.vim" is a file. The link generated by broswer is localhost:3000/autoload/, localhost:3000/bundle/ and localhost:3000/vimrc - https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/src/net/http/fs.go#L460 Expected to be serveFile(w, r, Dir(dir), file, true) here
